CD_CONFIRM_EXIT_MESSAGE: Êtes-vous sûr de vouloir quitter vers l'accueil ?
DBM_BTN_CREATE: Créer une nouvelle base de données
DBM_CONFIRM_DELETE_MSG: Êtes-vous sûr de vouloir supprimer la base de données '{{name}}' ? Cette action est irréversible.
DBM_CONFIRM_RESET_MSG: Êtes-vous sûr de vouloir réinitialiser la base de données actuelle aux paramètres d'usine ? Cela effacera toutes les données et ne pourra pas être annulé.
DBM_CONFIRM_RESET_MSG_1: Êtes-vous DANGEREUSEMENT sûr de vouloir RÉINITIALISER "{{name}}" aux paramètres d'usine ? TOUTES LES DONNÉES SERONT PERDUES.
DBM_CONFIRM_SWITCH_MSG: Êtes-vous sûr de vouloir passer à la base de données '{{name}}' ?
DBM_ERR_COPY: Erreur lors de la copie de la base de données
DBM_ERR_COPY_INACTIVE: Vous ne pouvez copier que la base de données active pour le moment. Veuillez d'abord passer à celle-ci.
DBM_ERR_CREATE: Erreur lors de la création de la base de données
DBM_ERR_DELETE: Erreur lors de la suppression de la base de données
DBM_ERR_DELETE_ACTIVE: Impossible de supprimer la base de données actuellement active. Veuillez d'abord passer à une autre base de données.
DBM_ERR_EXISTS: Une base de données avec ce nom existe déjà
DBM_ERR_IMPORT: Erreur lors de l'importation de la base de données
DBM_ERR_LOAD_INFO: Erreur lors du chargement des informations de la base de données
DBM_ERR_LOAD_INIT: Erreur lors du chargement des données initiales
DBM_ERR_LOAD_LIST: Erreur lors du chargement des bases de données
DBM_ERR_RESET: Erreur lors de la réinitialisation de la base de données
DBM_ERR_RESET_INACTIVE: Vous ne pouvez réinitialiser que la base de données active. Veuillez d'abord passer à celle-ci.
DBM_ERR_SWITCH: Erreur lors du changement de base de données
DBM_HINT_SELECT: Sélectionnez une base de données pour voir les détails.
DBM_HINT_SWITCH: Passez à cette base de données pour activer les opérations.
DBM_PROMPT_COPY_MSG: Entrez un nom pour la nouvelle copie de la base de données '{{name}}' :
DBM_PROMPT_CREATE_MSG: Entrez un nom pour la nouvelle base de données :
DBM_PROMPT_CREATE_TITLE: Créer une nouvelle base de données
DBM_PROMPT_IMPORT_MSG: Entrez le nom de la base de données importée '{{filename}}' :
DBM_SUCCESS_COPY: Base de données '{{name}}' copiée avec succès
DBM_SUCCESS_DELETE: Base de données '{{name}}' supprimée avec succès
DBM_SUCCESS_IMPORT: Base de données importada sous le nom '{{name}}'
DBM_SUCCESS_RESET: Base de données réinitialisée aux paramètres d'usine

RDS_QUOTE_1: “The development of full artificial intelligence could spell the end of the human race….It would take off on its own, and re-design itself at an ever increasing rate. Humans, who are limited by slow biological evolution, couldn’t compete, and would be superseded.” — Stephen Hawking
RDS_QUOTE_10: “Some people call this artificial intelligence, but the reality is this technology will enhance us. So instead of artificial intelligence, I think we’ll augment our intelligence.” — Ginni Rometty
RDS_QUOTE_11: “I’m more frightened than interested by artificial intelligence – in fact, perhaps fright and interest are not far away from one another. Things can become real in your mind, you can be tricked, and you believe things you wouldn’t ordinarily. A world run by automatons doesn’t seem completely unrealistic anymore. It’s a bit chilling.” — Gemma Whelan
RDS_QUOTE_12: “You have to talk about ‘The Terminator’ if you’re talking about artificial intelligence. I actually think that that’s way off. I don’t think that an artificially intelligent system that has superhuman intelligence will be violent. I do think that it will disrupt our culture.” — Gray Scott
RDS_QUOTE_13: “If the government regulates against use of drones or stem cells or artificial intelligence, all that means is that the work and the research leave the borders of that country and go someplace else.” — Peter Diamandis
RDS_QUOTE_14: “The key to artificial intelligence has always been the representation.” — Jeff Hawkins
RDS_QUOTE_15: “It’s going to be interesting to see how society deals with artificial intelligence, but it will definitely be cool.” — Colin Angle
RDS_QUOTE_16: “Anything that could give rise to smarter-than-human intelligence—in the form of Artificial Intelligence, brain-computer interfaces, or neuroscience-based human intelligence enhancement – wins hands down beyond contest as doing the most to change the world. Nothing else is even in the same league.” — Eliezer Yudkowsky
RDS_QUOTE_17: “Artificial intelligence is growing up fast, as are robots whose facial expressions can elicit empathy and make your mirror neurons quiver.” — Diane Ackerman
RDS_QUOTE_18: “Someone on TV has only to say, ‘Alexa,’ and she lights up. She’s always ready for action, the perfect woman, never says, ‘Not tonight, dear.’” — Sybil Sage
RDS_QUOTE_19: “Some people worry that artificial intelligence will make us feel inferior, but then, anybody in his right mind should have an inferiority complex every time he looks at a flower.” — Alan Kay
RDS_QUOTE_2: “I visualise a time when we will be to robots what dogs are to humans, and I’m rooting for the machines.” — Claude Shannon
RDS_QUOTE_20: “Artificial intelligence will reach human levels by around 2029. Follow that out further to, say, 2045, we will have multiplied the intelligence, the human biological machine intelligence of our civilization a billion-fold.” — Ray Kurzweil
RDS_QUOTE_21: “Nobody phrases it this way, but I think that artificial intelligence is almost a humanities discipline. It’s really an attempt to understand human intelligence and human cognition.” — Sebastian Thrun
RDS_QUOTE_22: “A year spent in artificial intelligence is enough to make one believe in God.” — Alan Perlis
RDS_QUOTE_23: “There is no reason and no way that a human mind can keep up with an artificial intelligence machine by 2035.” — Gray Scott
RDS_QUOTE_24: “Is artificial intelligence less than our intelligence?” — Spike Jonze
RDS_QUOTE_25: “By far, the greatest danger of Artificial Intelligence is that people conclude too early that they understand it.” — Eliezer Yudkowsky
RDS_QUOTE_26: “The sad thing about artificial intelligence is that it lacks artifice and therefore intelligence.” — Jean Baudrillard
RDS_QUOTE_27: “Forget artificial intelligence – in the brave new world of big data, it’s artificial idiocy we should be looking out for.” — Tom Chatfield
RDS_QUOTE_28: “Before we work on artificial intelligence why don’t we do something about natural stupidity?” — Steve Polyak
RDS_QUOTE_29: L'IA est un petit pas pour les systèmes de gestion de course, et un grand pas vers ma retraite. --Dave
RDS_QUOTE_3: “Artificial intelligence would be the ultimate version of Google. The ultimate search engine that would understand everything on the web. It would understand exactly what you wanted, and it would give you the right thing. We’re nowhere near doing that now. However, we can get incrementally closer to that, and that is basically what we work on.” — Larry Page
RDS_QUOTE_4: “The pace of progress in artificial intelligence (I’m not referring to narrow AI) is incredibly fast. Unless you have direct exposure to groups like Deepmind, you have no idea how fast—it is growing at a pace close to exponential. The risk of something seriously dangerous happening is in the five-year time frame. 10 years at most.” — Elon Musk
RDS_QUOTE_5: “The upheavals [of artificial intelligence] can escalate quickly and become scarier and even cataclysmic. Imagine how a medical robot, originally programmed to rid cancer, could conclude that the best way to obliterate cancer is to exterminate humans who are genetically prone to the disease.” — Nick Bilton
RDS_QUOTE_6: “I don’t want to really scare you, but it was alarming how many people I talked to who are highly placed people in AI who have retreats that are sort of ‘bug out’ houses, to which they could flee if it all hits the fan.” — James Barrat
RDS_QUOTE_7: “I’m increasingly inclined to think that there should be some regulatory oversight, maybe at the national and international level, just to make sure that we don’t do something very foolish. I mean with artificial intelligence we’re summoning the demon.” — Elon Musk
RDS_QUOTE_8: “The real question is, when will we draft an artificial intelligence bill of rights? What will that consist of? And who will get to decide that?” — Gray Scott
RDS_QUOTE_9: “We must address, individually and collectively, moral and ethical issues raised by cutting-edge research in artificial intelligence and biotechnology, which will enable significant life extension, designer babies, and memory extraction.” — Klaus Schwab
